parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To raise, lift up, take away, remove.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Already; now at length, now after all this waiting. Apparently from e and de; even now.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To stink, be offensive. A primary verb; to scent: stink.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Martha, sister of Mary and Lazarus of Bethany. Probably of Chaldee origin; Martha, a Christian woman.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A sister, a woman (fellow-)member of a church, a Christian woman. Fem of adephos; a sister.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To end, finish, die, complete. From a presumed derivative of teleo; to finish life, i.e. Expire.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Of the fourth day, four days since. From tessares; pertaining to the fourth day.
